  "article_text": [
    "in @xcite puknszky introduced an invariant for a maximal abelian self - adjoint subalgebra ( masa ) inside a separable @xmath0factor , which he used to exhibit a countable infinite family of singular masas in the hyperfinite @xmath0factor no pair of which are conjugate by an automorphism .",
    "the invariant associates a non - empty subset of @xmath1 to each masa @xmath4 in a separable @xmath0factor @xmath5 as follows .",
    "let @xmath6 be the abelian von neumann subalgebra of @xmath7 generated by @xmath4 and @xmath8 , where @xmath9 denotes the canonical involution operator on @xmath10 .",
    "the orthogonal projection @xmath11 from @xmath10 onto @xmath12 lies in @xmath6 and the algebra @xmath13 is type @xmath14 so decomposes as a direct sum of type @xmath15-algebras .",
    "the puknszky invariant of @xmath4 is the set of those @xmath16 appearing in this decomposition and is denoted @xmath17 .",
    "see also ( * ? ? ?",
    "* section 2 ) .",
    "there has been recent interest in the range of values of the puknszky invariant in various @xmath0factors .",
    "nesheyev and strmer used ergodic constructions to show that any set containing @xmath18 arises as a puknszky invariant of a masa in the hyperfinite @xmath0factor ( * ? ? ?",
    "* corollary 3.3 ) .",
    "sinclair and smith produced further subsets using group theoretic properties in @xcite and with dykema in @xcite , which also examines free group factors . in the other direction dykema has shown that @xmath19 , whenever @xmath4 is a masa in a free group factor @xcite .    in this paper",
    "we show that every non - empty subset of @xmath1 arises as the puknskzy invariant of a masa in the hyperfinite @xmath0factor by means of an approximation argument .",
    "more generally we obtain the same result in any separable mcduff @xmath0factor containing a simple masa , that is one with puknskzy invariant @xmath2 ( corollary [ main.simplemcduff ] ) .",
    "these factors are the first for which the range of the puknskzy invariant has been fully determined . without assuming the presence of a simple masa we are able to show that every separable mcduff @xmath0factor contains a masa with puknskzy invariant @xmath20 and",
    "hence we obtain every subset of @xmath1 containing @xmath3 as a puknszky invariant of some masa in these factors ( theorem [ main.generalmcduff ] ) .",
    "in particular , there are uncountably many singular masas in any separably mcduff factor , no pair of which is conjugate by an automorphism of the factor .",
    "section [ values ] contains a construction for producing masas in mcduff @xmath0factors .",
    "given a mcduff @xmath0factor @xmath21 we shall repeatedly tensor on copies of the hyperfinite @xmath0factor  this gives us a chain @xmath22 of @xmath0factors whose direct limit @xmath5 is isomorphic to @xmath21 .",
    "we shall produce a masa @xmath4 in @xmath5 by giving an approximating sequence of masas @xmath23 in each @xmath24 such that @xmath25 and defining @xmath26 .",
    "this idea has its origin in @xcite working in the hyperfinite @xmath0factor arising as the infinite tensor produce of finite matrix algebras , although using finite matrix algebras can only yield masas with puknskzy invariant @xmath2 , ( * ? ? ?",
    "* theorem 4.1 ) .    in the remainder of the introduction we outline the construction of a masa with puknszky invariant @xmath27 .",
    "initially we shall produce a masa @xmath28 in @xmath29 such that the multiplicity structure of @xmath30 ( the algebra generated by the left - right action of @xmath28 on @xmath31 ) is represented by figure [ intro.fig1 ] . by this",
    "we mean that @xmath32 is a projection of trace @xmath33 in @xmath4 and that @xmath34 and @xmath35 are both type @xmath36 , while @xmath37 and @xmath38 are type @xmath39 .",

    "we then cut each of these projections in half again and ensure that the multiplicity structure of @xmath43 is represented by the second diagram in figure [ intro.fig2 ] , where @xmath18 s appear down the diagonal .",
    "it is important to do this in such a way that a limiting argument can be used to obtain the multiplicity structure of @xmath44 .",
    "if this is done successfully , then the multiplicity structure of @xmath6 will be represented by figure [ intro.fig3 ] , where the diagonal line has multiplicity @xmath18 .",

    "the resulting masa @xmath4 will then have puknszky invariant @xmath27 as required .",
    "( 80,80 ) ( 0,0)(1,0)80 ( 0,40)(1,0)80 ( 0,80)(1,0)80 ( 0,0)(0,1)80 ( 40,0)(0,1)80 ( 80,0)(0,1)80 ( 0,80)(1,-1)80 ( 17,17)2 ( 57,57)2 ( 27,67)3 ( 7,47)3 ( 47,7)3 ( 67,27)3    to get from figure [ intro.fig1 ] to the left diagram in figure [ intro.fig2 ] in a compatible way , we ` tensor on ' the diagram in figure [ intro.fig4 ] .",

    "the main result is theorem [ sumcartan.countablefamily ] , which ensures that the family @xmath46 above , and other families in this style can indeed be found . in section [ values ]",
    "we give the details of the inductive construction and in section [ mainlem ] we compute the puknszky invariant of the resulting masa .",
    "we end in section [ main ] by collecting together the main results .",

    "let @xmath313 denote the set of all @xmath314 where @xmath315 is a sequence of zeros and ones of length @xmath316 .",
    "in this way the last sequence , @xmath317 , has length @xmath113 and each earlier sequence is one element longer than the following sequence .",

    "note that @xmath319 has length @xmath320 so that this restriction does lie in @xmath318 .",

    "suppose that @xmath21 is a separable mcduff @xmath0factor containing a masa with puknszky invariant @xmath520 .",
    "for every non - empty set @xmath521 , there exists a masa @xmath4 in @xmath21 with @xmath522 .",
    "let @xmath264 be a masa in @xmath21 with @xmath523 and choose the values @xmath524 for @xmath312 and @xmath334 with @xmath335 and @xmath336 so that @xmath525 the resulting masa @xmath4 in @xmath526 produced by the main construction has puknszky invariant @xmath527 by theorem [ mainlem.puk ] .",
    "[ main.simplemcduff ] let @xmath5 be a mcduff @xmath0factor containing a simple masa , for example a cartan masa .",
    "every non - empty subset of @xmath61 arises as the puknszky invariant of a masa in @xmath5 .",
    "a little more care enables us to address the question of the range of the puknszky invariant on singular masas in the hyperfinite @xmath0factor and other mcduff @xmath0factors containing a simple singular masa .",
    "puknszky s original work @xcite exhibits a simple singular masa in the hyperfinite @xmath0factor .",

    "the idea is to control the supremum of the trace of a projection in the masa @xmath4 such that @xmath567 for some fixed @xmath568 . for each @xmath569",
    ", we can produce masas @xmath4 in @xmath47 and a projection @xmath570 with @xmath571 such that ( with the intuitive diagrams of the introduction ) the multiplicity structure of @xmath6 is represented by figure [ main.fig ] , with @xmath18 down the diagonal and @xmath572 occurring in the unmarked areas .",
    "all these masas must be pairwise non - conjugate .",
    "no modifications are required to obtain any diadic rational for @xmath573 , we follow theorem [ main.directsum ] to control the multiplicity structure of @xmath6 . for general @xmath573 we can approximate the required structure using diadic rationals , leaving the area we are unable to handle at each stage with multiplicity @xmath18 so it can be adjusted at a subsequent stage .    for a masa @xmath4 in a property @xmath574-factor @xmath5 , the property that @xmath4 contains non - trivial centralising sequences for @xmath5 has been used to distinguish between non - conjugate masas , see for example @xcite .",
    "we can easily adjust the construction of section [ values ] to ensure that all the masas produced have this property .",
    "suppose that we identify each @xmath296 with @xmath575 and we replace the masas @xmath576 in @xmath296 by @xmath577 where @xmath578 is a fixed cartan masa in @xmath296 .",
    "by lemma [ prelim.mixtensor ] this does not alter the mixed puknszky invariants of the family , so the puknszky invariant of the masa resulting from the construction remains unchanged .",
    "this masa now contains non - trivial centralising sequences for @xmath5 . by way of contrast",
    ", the examples in @xcite arise from inclusions @xmath579 of a an abelian group inside a discrete i.c.c .",
    "group @xmath580 with @xmath581 for all @xmath582 .",
    "the resulting masa @xmath583 can not contain non - trivial centralising sequences for the @xmath0factor @xmath584 , @xcite .",
    "very recently ozawa and popa have shown that not every mcduff @xmath0factor contains a cartan masa .",
    "indeed in @xcite they show that there are no cartan masas in @xmath585 .",
    "it is not known whether every mcduff factor must contain a simple masa ( one with puknskzy invariant @xmath2 ) or a masa whose puknszky invariant is a finite subset of @xmath586 .",
    "we can however obtain subsets containing @xmath3 as puknszky invariants of masas in a general separable mcduff @xmath0factor .",
    "taking all the @xmath588 , gives us a masa @xmath4 in @xmath5 with @xmath589 by theorem [ mainlem.puk ] ( regardless of the masa @xmath264 ) .",

    "lemma 2.1 of @xcite gives @xmath593                v.  jones and s.  popa .",
    "some properties of masas in factors . in _",
    "invariant subspaces and other topics ( timioara / herculane , 1981 ) _ , volume  6 of _ operator theory : adv .",
    "_ , pages 89102 .",
    "birkhuser , basel , 1982 ."
  ],
  "abstract_text": [
    "<S> in 1960 puknszky introduced an invariant associating to every masa in a separable @xmath0factor a non - empty subset of @xmath1 . this invariant examines the multiplicity structure of the von neumann algebra generated by the left - right action of the masa . in this paper </S>",
    "<S> it is shown that any non - empty subset of @xmath1 arises as the puknszky invariant of some masa in a separable mcduff @xmath0factor containing a masa with puknszky invariant @xmath2 . </S>",
    "<S> in particular the hyperfinite @xmath0factor and all separable mcduff @xmath0factors with a cartan masa satisfy this hypothesis . in a general separable mcduff @xmath0factor </S>",
    "<S> we show that every subset of @xmath1 containing @xmath3 is obtained as a puknszky invariant of some masa . </S>"
  ]
}
